This promoter was identified by microarray assays with a mutant σ<sup>54</sup> strain and a σ<sup>54</sup>-overexpressing strain, and by σ<sup>54</sup>-related promoter element identification |CITS:[RDBECOLIPRC11649]|.

We assigned a putative transcription start site to this promoter based on the observation that the majority of the σ<sup>54</sup>-dependent promoters, whose transcription start sites were determined experimentally, present a distance of 11 nucleotides between the transcription start site and the  -12 box |CITS: [RDBECOLIPRC00619]|.

The Escherichia coli Ada protein can interact with two distinct determinants in the sigma70 subunit of RNA polymerase according to promoter architecture: identification of the target of Ada activation at the alkA promoter.

promoter.note: σ70 is the sigma factor principally responsible for the alkA transcription. However alkA is highly dependent on alternative factor σ38 (RpoS) during the stationary phase. In contrast, the transcription factor Ada in its methylated state negatively regulates σ38-dependent transcription |CITS: [RDBECOLIPRC00635]|. EσS is more efficient than Eσ70 in carrying out transcription from the alkA promoter in the absence of Ada (Ada is a repressor for EσS) |CITS:[RDBECOLIPRC00635]|.

publication.title: In vitro transcription profiling of the σS subunit of bacterial RNA polymerase: re-definition of the σS regulon and identification of σS-specific promoter sequence elements.
In vitro transcription profiling of the σS subunit of bacterial RNA polymerase: re-definition of the σS regulon and identification of σS-specific promoter sequence elements.

promoter.note: Based on ChIP-microarray analysis, it was shown that StpA binds to the promoter region in appYp2 |CITS:[RDBECOLIPRC27241][RDBECOLIPRC10718]|. qRT-PCR revealed a strong 75-fold repression of appY by H-NS and more than 1,000-fold repression by H-NS/StpA |CITS:[RDBECOLIPRC18945]|. Transcription directed across H-NS binding regions relieves H-NS-mediated (and H-NS/StpA-mediated) repression of promoters such as proVp3, pdeLp3, and appYp2, and there is a correlation between transcription across the H-NS-bound region and derepression where RNA polymerase is able to remodel the H-NS complex and/or dislodge H-NS from the DNA and thus relieve repression |CITS:[RDBECOLIPRC18945]|.
